info.headline: Winter Storm Warning issued November 9 at 11:21AM CST until November 10 at 12:00PM CST by NWS Chicago IL
info.description:
* WHAT...Dangerous travel conditions due to lake effect snow expected. Snow rates of 1 to 2 inches per hour and localized snow accumulations of 6 to 10 inches expected.
* WHERE...Kankakee County.
* WHEN...From midnight tonight to noon CST Monday.
* IMPACTS...Untreated roads, and especially bridges and overpasses, may will become slick and hazardous.
* ADDITIONAL DETAILS...Lake effect snow is often very localized, with conditions varying from safe to dangerous across just a few miles. Snow totals in the Winter Storm Warning area may vary considerably from one location to the next, with the highest totals expected near and east of Interstate 57.
info.instruction:
Persons should consider delaying all travel. Motorists should use extreme caution if travel is absolutely necessary.
During lake effect snow, the weather can vary from bands of locally heavy snow to dry weather just a few miles away. Visibilities can also vary greatly. Be prepared for rapid changes in weather, visibility, and road conditions.

parameter.value: WINTER STORM WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT FROM MIDNIGHT TONIGHT TO NOON CST MONDAY
